history.title: History
history.subtitle: Discover the origins and evolution of Senghor University, born from an ambitious vision for the development of Francophone Africa.

genesis.title: The 70s-80s Project
genesis.description: The project to create a French-speaking university dedicated to African development was born at the Summit of Heads of State and Government of French-speaking countries, held in May 1989 in Dakar. This ambitious initiative aimed to provide Africa with a higher education institution capable of training highly qualified African executives.
genesis.point1: Initiative born at the Francophonie Summit in Dakar
genesis.point2: Vision of excellence to train tomorrow's African leaders

founders.title: The Founding Fathers
founders.subtitle: Visionary figures who shaped the institution

senghor.role: Poet, thinker and former President of Senegal

usenghor.title: USenghor Project
usenghor.description: Senghor University officially opens its doors in Alexandria, Egypt. It bears the name of Léopold Sédar Senghor, a major figure in the Francophonie, who played a central role in promoting French-speaking identity around the world.

milestone1.title: Opening in Alexandria
milestone1.desc: October 1990 - The university welcomes its first students

milestone2.title: Reference in training
milestone2.desc: Over 30 years of excellence in development professions

legacy.title: An Enduring Mission
legacy.description: For over 30 years, Senghor University has pursued its ambitious mission: training future African and Francophone executives capable of meeting major development challenges, while strengthening ties between Africa and the international Francophonie.
